com.github.liblevenshtein.transducer

Class SpecialPosition

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.liblevenshtein.transducer.Position
      • com.github.liblevenshtein.transducer.SpecialPosition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class SpecialPosition
extends Position
implements Serializable
    SpecialPositions are used to maintain a sorted, linked-list of positions within States. They are sorted to simplify and optimize various operations on the positions (like subsumption and merging-in new positions).
    Since:
    3.0.0
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpecialPosition

        public SpecialPosition(int termIndex,
                       int numErrors)
        Builds a new Position, extended with some special operation (e.g. transposition or merge-and-split).
        Parameters:
        termIndex - Index of the dictionary term represented by this coordinate.
        numErrors - Number of accumulated errors at this coordinate.
